Bruna is a nice love interest but there was no chemistry and yet her role was a waste as useless female side kick with no backstory.Unfortunately it all comes down to a solid screenplay and an original story which this film is neither so the terrible casting just added more drama to this failure of yet another DC film.DC is a global brand that requires a universal story. The audience has matured and this is a sad excuse of a film that should have never been green lit. End of story.3 stars for the Blue Beetle suit and George Lopez comedy.

title: A film released in an time of superhero fatigue
text: Imagine going to an all you can eat buffet every couple weeks where you're now just sick of 'insert food here'Sure...you can eat it - but it's meh now. Done to death. You've eaten so much meat/bbq you're contemplating being vegan - even for a short time.Just - anything to alleviate the monotony. A brief respite.You now want a salad to watch with your partner. You don't even really like salads. It's just so you can rest your now bloated guts. Dry your meat sweaty brow.This is unfortunately what it's like to watch Blue Beetle after being subjected to 10 years+ of superhero franchise. I loved superhero movies. They were so good. But the MCU & it's wish version - the DCEU have dulled the senses.Actors were good - but just another poor, done to death premise.

title: BEETLE POWER! An awesome superhero film of the DCEU!
text: Xolo is the guy to play Jaime Reyes and Blue Beetle. All those martial arts from Cobra Kai gave Xolo to be prepared for this superhero. George Lopez is still funniest comedian for the entire Hispanic community. Susan Sarandon definitely nailed her character as the vile Victoria Kord; she's definitely the character that you will love to hate. I remember she played the evil Queen Narissa from Disney's Enchanted.In superhero films, the main character would value romance like an example of Clark Kent falling in love with Lois Lane from the 1978 Superman film or Bruce Wayne falling in love with Vicki Vale from the 1989 Batman film. In some scenes, Jaime falls in love with Jenny Kord. Blue Beetle definitely values family. It's just like Shazam and his family.The scenes and locations of Palmera City remind me of walking through Miami, Puerto Rico or El Paso, Texas. I've read that they shot some scenes in El Paso. The action sequences were awesome and there were also funny moments with George Lopez. This movie had a lot of heart but there were also dark moments and scenes that made me cry a bit. Even the special effects blew my mind as well. This movie is awesome and cool. When it comes to watching superhero movies, the action, drama and special effects are brilliant and magnificent. Blue Beetle is one of the best movies to watch.

title: The worst "super hero" movie ever
text: So to start with the good, the CGI is ok and well that's about it. The story is boring and predictable. The humor is just plain and stupid. The characters are one dimensional. The acting is completely phoned in. I love action and sci-fi movies, but this one is just horrible. By the time the movie was half over (which btw the run time is way too long) I was regretting my decision to watch this garbage. I would really like to know how the producers thought this was worth releasing. The story has all the potential but this falls so short of what it should have been. I'm sorry to trash it so hard, but if anything I've been too easy on this movie.

title: Minority superhero
text:
He goes too far with the Mexican minority, so much so that he makes fun of Mexican culture, history, language...shame. Even the symbol of the beetle suggests that it is normal for Mexicans to encounter bugs (cockroaches).When the characters speak in Spanish, they do not bother with the translation at all, but it is shown as their internal, incomprehensible conversation.Not to mention, lackluster, boring action...of course, the superhero is against killing...too bad, the ending should have ended with mariachi...
Do not waste your time...another DC poor experiment...too far from DC world...that it.

title: Finally!! Super fun!!
text: This a night & day difference from almost every other DC Superhero film, for one - I could actually see everything!! This film is properly lit, thank goodness! There are none of those weird ass slow-motion scenes that I guess were supposed to showcase Superman's/Wonder Woman's powers, again, thank goodness. This is a true origin story (and while a definite case can be made that Superman & Batman did not need DC origin stories, I feel like Wonder Woman - an origin story - was the most composed film that came out under Geoff Johns' DCEU) Xolo is so charismatic & the whole cast has a ton of chemistry!! I went in complete blind, knowing nothing about the character of Jaime Reyes or the Blue Beetle & I thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it's 2 hour & 7 min run time.

title: Trash
text: This is just trash. I read some Blue Beetle comics like a decade ago and they were fine, relatively good and relatively interesting. Not as good as Spider-Man comics were for me, but they probably had the closet alternative to them from DC (the one I knew of, at least). The movie, though... It's just... Trash. I don't have other words for this.First 30 minutes or so were complete snooze-fest, and even when we passed that mark and got to see the suit - it still was not as exciting, because it did not make much sense. Jackie Chan's "The Tuxedo" was a waaaay better representation of a trope "I have a powerful suit and don't know how to control it. Even before that, why would the so "important" object as the Scarab be stored practically without security? Even B-Movies from 80s knew better.I also did not care for any of the characters. They felt worse than any character in Arrowverse after like 4th season of "The Flash". In fact, I think if they introduced Blue Beetle to Arrowverse it would have been a much better fit. But instead we got another attempt from DC to be like Marvel, when even Marvel themselves has started missing a mark more often than not. DC needs to realize, that copy-pasting and making these "ha-ha" movies does no good to them, because that's just not what the audience want.

title: It's as bad as expected. Don't waste your time.
text: Yeah, the rumors are true: this movie is hot garbage. 1 out of 10, being super generous.This is genuinely The Flash, Shazam 2, and Black Adam territory. But while those were mostly boring movies, this one was particularly painful to watch.I won't dabble too much. The casting was good, and they were wasted by one of the worst screenwriting I have ever seen, bar none. This movie makes Scorpion King look good.The movie's first half is annoying, the dialogue is beyond obnoxious, and it's excruciating and a waste of time. There is no coming back from this.They gave up from the beginning. This movie makes no attempt to be taken seriously. It's 100% campy. But it's not the fun kind of camp. It's really the obnoxious type. The one that treats the audience like stupid little kids. Not even cartoons go this far.There is nothing here. Uncle Rudy is a big brain genius, even though he lives in his brother's house because he can't find a job, and he is super obnoxious and on the nose all the time. He's tiresome. The sister is a big-mouth complainer straight out of Twitter. Not even Grandma was spared from this travesty. She starts as a very sympathetic lady, and by the end, she is basically The Terminator's grandma.The father is in the background for the entire first half. We know nothing about him. And suddenly, he becomes the wisest one out of nowhere. They tried to make him Uncle Ben, but there was no development to earn that. And this is a theme throughout the movie. The main villain is a grotesque Iron Monger bootleg. No development, and by the end, we are supposed to sympathize with him because of 30 seconds of backstory added at the very last minute. Lazy doesn't even begin to describe this screenwriting.Jaime Reyes and Jenny Kord are supposed to be a romantic duo but have zero chemistry. None, zip, nada. It doesn't work, feels forced, and is beyond cringe.The CGI and battles are okay, nothing special. And they have no idea how to build up a good battle. Out of nowhere, they need the hero to be nerfed; otherwise, the movie would end too soon. The solution? Make the alien suit decide to reboot out of the blue. I believe it runs Windows? Random stuff like this breaks the immersion all the time.Even bad movies like The Last Jedi or Rise of Skywalker can be reused in fan edits. They just cut off the bad parts (Canto Bay), and some usable material remains. But this movie? Nothing. There is nothing there. Cutting off the bad parts means leaving enough for a short music video.It's not even a bad movie in the sense of "oh, ok, this is not Oscar material, but it's still fun, like the Fast and Furious franchise." No, this is not enjoyable at all. As I said, it is painful to endure until the end.I should even reconsider this 1 out of 10. Maybe a zero would be more fitting.Don't waste your time on this one. Or have some drinks before watching.

title: People are such harsh critics
text: I had no intent of seeing this movie in theater but my partner is a big DC fan so why not. I was thoroughly shocked with how good this movie was. I don't understand the hate it gets. It definitely was more of the lighter super hero movies we've had between DC and MARVEL recently but that's not necessarily a bad thing at all. The acting was phenomenal from all the cast with some of the least known being able to keep up with more well known. I'm never one for corny messages in movies but the one in this about having a strong family unit was touching especially during the climax when the family needed to come together even closer. The Nana was a hoot, absolutely loved her! Give this movie a chance!!!!! I had no intent in seeing it and absolutely loved it!!

title: Fun movie but falls short of its competition in the marvel universe.
text: Is this a dud? No, in comparison to the rest of the DC universe films. Ticks the boxes for a fun rainy day movie. Nothing of substance to warrant a repeat viewing like so many of the Marvel universe films. Some strange social messaging blended in that just falls short of any point. Boilerplate superhero movie plot with unsatisfying resolve. Better than Aquaman so it has that going for it. At least its a fresh hero added to the universe and as a JLE fan would like to see characters from that division be explored more. Booster Gold would have been a nice cameo. Not sure why DC struggles so much with their movies but this one fell short with some real potiental. Disapointed but caught it for 5 bucks at AMC so cant complain for 2 hours spent.

title: bad acting and script
text:
Bad acting and script
I didn't enjoy watching it at all, on the contrary, I browsed social media. I think I wouldn't be going too far if I said it was a waste of time.DC does this all the time
Far from original creativity. The movie just couldn't attract me.So much so that I had never commented here before, it even made me do this.They made ridiculous dialogues to make it funny. A tragic event was happening, I was even indifferent to it. You ask why? What follows are ridiculous jokes and facial expressions.In short, it was a mixture of Spawn and Ironman, but it could not become a movie.

title: The story of the movie is completely repetitive
text:
Blue Beetle attempts to introduce the DC Universe's first Latino superhero, but fails to deliver a repetitive story.A1-MCI
After the success of superhero movies over the past decades, filmmakers have decided to invest in new and lesser-known superheroes to not only tap into a new source for adaptations, but to expand the scope of using superheroes of the opposite sex, color, and race. Give Now the movie Blue Beetle is supposed to be the first movie of the DC universe which is produced with the focus of the Latino superhero. The story of this movie focuses on the character of Jimmy Reyes, who is actually the third Blue Beetle of the DC comic world.

title: PLEASE watch and be the judge yourself! :)
text: At first I was skeptical to watch it since EVERY DC movies has been trash but to my surprise this movie was good and funny to watch! Perhaps many people here didn't enjoy it since most of the jokes/parts would only be understood if you grew up in a Spanish household. I absolutely loved it and give it a 9/10, would've loved more fighting scenes from blue beetle. I loved how it included some reality parts from a Hispanic family such as the vapor rub or your Nana praying over you or how strong a Hispanic house hold can be and despite of what happens to us we overcome obstacle together as ONE! AGIAN please watch and you be the judge! :)

title: So much wasted potential.
text: I was a huge fan of the Ted Kord era Blue Beetle, and only really came across Reyes version during the Infinite Crisis story arc. However, what I know is that this was an opportunity for DC to craft their own Spider-Man like character (young, struggling with the hero life, and navigating family). Instead what we got was a movie which failed to create a visually striking environment (it tries from the title artwork, to the neon signs.... but doesn't have the character of the Guardians movies or Thor: Ragnarok), fails to give us original characters and see their development (we get pared down version of the characters from Shang-Chi and Ant-Man), gives us the most one-dimensional bad guy since Iron Man 1, and ludicrous dialogue throughout.The movie feels like someone decided to make a superhero tele-novela.I wish it wasn't so. I wanted this to be great, and there are hints of it, like in the first transformation scene. But overall it felt like a script written by someone without deep love of the characters, and a cinematographer + director that thought throwing some neon in would make it edgy.

title: This movie is a crime against humanity.
text: How can you pack that much suck into only two hours? I really need to reevaluate my life at this point and stop morning that time I will never ever get back. It was so freaking dumb that I think I may have suffered brain damage by watching it. Worst of the worst. Can we hang up these B level superheroes? Enough already! I don't think there is anywhere else to go! It was awful on every possible level. It is devoid of any aspect of filmmaking that makes the finish product enjoyable unless you are 13 years old I am not seeing this being a franchise, thank god! What am I talking about? Of course, there will be a sequel. May God have mercy on all our souls.

title: Not Great
text: The Karate Kid sequel guy is fine. It's just not a good movie is the problem. It's like something that's gunning for a Nickelodeon Kid's Choice Award. Similar to Black Adam and the Shazam! Movies, there's nothing particularly offensive, but it's also completely forgettable. They're trying to leverage Mexican culture to distinguish this movie, but the core elements are exactly the same so it ends up coming across as just kind of racist. Otherwise it's like Wonder Woman 1984, where it has a lot of cartoonish vibes, over-acting mixed with flat acting, and every character has Home Alone levels of plot armor. Probably too immature for a teenager, so this is best for 10-12 year olds, probably to play in the background of a birthday party where they have something else more entertaining to do. Definitely not worth attempting to enjoy as any kind of cinematic experience though. It's like Black Adam and Shazam! But missing the positive elements of those movies. Blue Beetle belongs in the same universe as Ryan Reynolds' Green Lantern.

title: Little better than the Flash(movie)
text: Well where should I start. I should mention that this movie was different than any other origin movie you have seen. This had some environment of family which I found different and kind of liked.The action scenes are very nicely done. The camera movement and generally the fighting skills shown were really commendable. They actually engross you in the scene. On top of that background music was really great.Kind of fit with the whole and many scenes for kind of almost perfect. You could actually feel the feelings of different people and what they were going through.This thing is what I found different in this movie that this had a holistic approach i.e it wasn't more focused only the superhero and his fighting.Animations may seem a little off on buildings constructed by CGI but overall a negligible factor.Flash had all these things accept a good background score, I suppose. If you liked the Flash then you certainly will like this too.In any case it's a good stand alone film so even if you haven't been following DC it's a fun watch.

title: I hoped for a better movie
text:
The Good:
The Mediocre:
The Bad:
I had heard only a few complaints about this movie before watching it, so I was hoping for a fun story that just didn't hit the reviewers in my orbit the right way. But, no, this movie has only a few good concepts buried beneath bad and uninspired writing. I won't spoil the end of the final battle, but I will say--come on.

title: Painful to Watch
text: DC has a pretty bad track record already, but wow this one takes the cake. The writing, the acting, the plot line and concept are all cringier than anything DC has produced so far. I only saw this movie waiting for a haircut at my barber and I couldn't stand a single scene. I tried to ignore it, but it's like a car accident: horrible, but you can't stop looking at it. I NEVER write reviews, but I looked up the movie on IMDb to see how it fared and felt that 6 stars was way too high of a score for what this movie actually is. If you love watching cringe videos on youtube, this is the movie 4 u.

title: It's not for adults even though it's rated M
text: I had never heard about the movie so I watched with no prior expectations. I think this movie is made for teenagers not for general adults audience.I don't know what is wrong with the writers or what point they are trying to prove but if in real life someone is shooting to kill me or my family I will respond in kind.There's also no character development, you really don't know too much about the main character of the movie.The comedy is really bad, it's written with a terrible sense of humour, if you can call it humour. I would recommend the writers take a comedy 101 lesson.Overall I think the movie is a failure and I wouldn't recommend it unless you're age range is 10 to 15.

title: Great surprise, great soundtrack
text: At first it was difficult for me to get hooked on the movie, but as it went on I got deeper and deeper into the story and I ended up liking it a lot, touches of humor, action and syfy, you can say that it has many sinilirudes in the plot to another Marvel movie but I liked this one more than its Marvel counterpart. I was very surprised by the music they used and above all that the suit is not like what you see in all the other superhero movies, breaking the mold and being something different in terms of its texture and design. On the other hand, it seemed to me that the actors were very consistent with the tone of the film and the story. I really hope for a sequel in the new DCU.

title: Better than the average DC movie worse than the average Marvel movie
text: Like i said in the title, it's better than many of the DC movie probably their 3rd 4th best movie in the DCU), and on par with the generic marvel movies .It does takes a lot from marvel movies though, this is basically Iron man 1 & 2 x Spiderman ... and by that, i mean they literally took some scenes / jokes from those movies and reproduced them ...So frankly, it's not as bad as some people make it sound, when i read those comment i even wonder why those people even watch such movie they clearly don't like them... but it's still pretty generic, unoriginal as it copy many stuff from marvel movies etc... something i'll clearly never rewatch, if you don't watchit, you'd miss nothing serious.Anyway at this point, you can consider the DCU dead anyway ...

title: Fits AFV better than DCU
text: Appreciate the creativity. Acting was fine. Action was acceptable. However, mobilizing grandma to be a superhero revolutionary and turning the family into Beetle wars was a little too much. I hope a second movie moves into the DC mainstream of fighting villains.This was good to lay the foundation for the superhero, but at times it just seemed silly. There didn't seem to be any real plot but to unrealistically portray women as both villains and saviors in order to appeal to girls from the evil boss to the voice of khaji. There was too much foul language for a young audience and the only thing driving the Blue Beetle is his anger. I hope improvements are made in the future to make it more enjoyable. Take a lesson from a movie series like Guardians of the Galaxy in terms of character development, plot, music and mystery. And for heaven's sake keep political and personal agendas out and make it entertaining.

title: Have all the Superhero Films already been written?
text: Honestly the 5/10 is possibly a bit generous but Xolo Maridueña gave such a great performance that it certainly lifts the film. Apart from that, what more can be said? It's just another Superhero Film which to me, is heartbreaking to say because 5 years ago, I would be saying the more the merrier! Little did I know that writers would be going on strike because they were worried about AI stealing their jobs (I am aware it's not just that, pay is a massive factor too) but it feels like AI is already writing these films..... It is SO by the numbers. It could easily be just another Iron Man/Spider-Man/Ant-Man/Shazam! Etc. It just happens to be about Blue Beetle who is actually a fun and interesting character but is in a mostly boring movie.The weirdest decision in this film is that Jaime is extremely against killing but I guess is perfectly fine with his family members doing it....? Jaime isn't aware of this moment at the time but Rudy kills someone and Mili yells "20 points!". It is so incredibly jarring consindering like 10 minutes ago Jaime was adamant about not killing.Anyway you already know everything that is going to happen in this film within the first 5 minutes, even the credits scenes were predictable.

title: Typical but still fun superhero film
text: Blue Beetle tells the story of Jaime Reyes (Mariduena) as he finds himself at a crossroads in his life. He is the first person in his family to graduate from university but comes home to find his family struggling financially largely due to the hands of Kord Industries led by the power hungry leader Victoria Kord (Sarandon). Jaime is desperate to do anything to support his family, so when he comes across Kord's niece Jenny (Marquezine) who asks him to protect a stolen piece of alien technology, he accepts. But the technology unwittingly chooses him and infuses him with godlike powers. He must now learn how to control the persona of the Blue Beetle, a figure who can create any weaponry with his mind.The first two thirds of the movie are a generic fun blockbuster led by a man born to play the role of Jaime Reyes. Xolo Mariduena is a delight as the main character and plays the unwilling hero trope to perfection. He is a good kid that can still become emotional as anyone would be if they were thrusted into receiving godlike powers. However, it does mean that for the first two acts of the movie he is basically untouchable. This does detract from some of the tension the movie tries to build. However, the third act does offer some twists.As Jaime is put into this terrible situation, the people he loves most, his Nana (Barraza), Mother (Carrillo), sister (Escobedo), father (Alcazar) and uncle (Lopez) are all put in peril and have to come to terms with the fact that Jaime cannot be anyone other than Blue Beetle. The family dynamic is what really makes this movie truly special, they didn't ask to have their house foreclosed nor did they ask to have their son/grandson/brother/nephew infected with alien technology, but they came together and each one of them got an emotionally acted moment to shine in the movie. Every single family member got to get involved in the action, and because of that angle, it truly embodied the Mexican/Latina spirit so incredibly well.The third act of the movie makes it worth watching, but it does not necessarily forgive the movie from being formulaic in the first two acts. From the secondary villain (Trujillo) being the same as the hero but evil, to the main villain being just a power hungry military industrial manufacturer only after money, to love interest character also being an exposition machine; it even has a henchmen with a change of heart. This movie is full of these plot points that can be formulaic/weightless at best to dragging at worst, and it is exemplified by the fact that for most of the movie, the audience cannot see Blue Beetle or Karapax's face in the suits, they are just two faceless creatures punching and shooting electric pulses at each other. And it really is a shame because they could have just played up the biggest selling point of the movie: family and how even though they are not superpowered, they are the strong shell that protects their respective selves. There is one twist I did like involving the secondary antagonist's backstory which I thought should have gotten more screentime, and does tie into the themes well. This plot point is effective because it not only breaks the suits and reveals their faces of the characters but also their imperfections, and gives the actors a chance to deliver heart wrenching performances. However, like the suits, this movie brings up some heavy topics in the first act like gentrification of Hispanic neighbourhoods and imperialism and its effects on Central and South America and hides them from the audience for the vast majority of the movie.This movie could have been greater then the sum of its parts, but in the end I am just relieved that it was as good as it was, given the circumstances surrounding it's tie-ins to the larger picture. The DC Extended Universe is coming to an end, and taking its place is the DC Universe, and I do not know if this movie will be successful enough to continue on the family legacy. I do hope that Xolo Mariduena continues to play Blue Beetle because he is a charismatic and humorous talent that can make an audience both laugh and cry, but above all else I hope that Nana (Barraza) joins the Justice League alongside Superman and Batman.

title: Host Overreacting...
text: I went in with an open mind hoping to enjoy this, but sadly it's just not a very good movie. The script is awful which directly affects the performances. It didn't matter whether the actors were good or not because the writing was so bad that it made their job an impossible task. I really enjoyed Xolo Maridueña in Cobra Kai and he does what he can, but much like the rest of the cast the horrible dialogue is just too much for him to overcome. The only actor who is able to maintain some semblance of dignity (ironically) is George Lopez. The writers knew exactly what they wanted to do with Rudy and his character was the best written in the film. It is obvious that Susan Sarandon is having a good time playing a cartoon villain but she had a lot more success playing an actual cartoon villain in Enchanted. Here she is just over-the-top in a movie that can't decide whether it wants to be superhero or reality based. Overall, I can see why this did so poorly and that no one saw it. I wish I hadn't.

title: Blue Beetle (2023): A Missed Opportunity
text: There's always room for fresh takes on iconic characters and the introduction of new heroes to the cinematic universe. However, the recent release of Blue Beetle, unfortunately, falls short of this potential, failing to deliver a captivating origin story.The film follows Jaime Reyes, a young Mexican-American teenager who discovers an ancient alien scarab that merges with his backpack and grants him transformative superpowers. As Jaime navigates the challenges of high school and his newfound responsibilities as a superhero, he must also confront the villainous forces that threaten his city.Despite the promising premise, Blue Beetle fails to capture the essence of what makes a truly compelling superhero origin story. The film's narrative struggles to find its footing, meandering through a series of predictable events and uninspired plotlines.Jaime Reyes, the titular Blue Beetle, is a character with a rich backstory and untapped potential. However, Xolo Maridueña's portrayal falls flat, lacking the charisma and emotional depth necessary to make the character truly relatable and engaging. The supporting cast, while offering some semblance of personality, fails to elevate the lackluster script.The film's action sequences, a crucial element in any superhero film, are another major disappointment. The CGI is subpar and outdated, creating a visual spectacle that feels cheap and uninspired. The fight scenes are poorly choreographed and lack any real excitement or intensity, failing to capture the thrill and excitement of superhero action.Blue Beetle's failure to deliver on so many levels is a missed opportunity to introduce a new and promising superhero to the cinematic landscape. The film's weak performances, uninspired story, and lacklustre action sequences leave audiences with a sense of disappointment, failing to ignite the passion and excitement that make superhero movies so popular.

title: Stop processing grief like it was nothing
text: I had bad expectations. It was a good surprise for the first half of the movie. Not extraordinary in any way, but quite enjoyable. Then the writers made a bad choice for the tone of the movie by creating a drama in the middle of the movie (which was totally not necessary) , and then make all the characters just have real fun while using cool tools and killing bad guys like nothing happened. The movie lost me at that point. There is even a scene where the grandma have a big smile while the others are trying to act a bit like they still feel at least a bit what happened. God, this is so stupid. No real emotions, and the characters that were quite relatable weren't anymore. I think the writers do not understand that while people usually need fun to engage in a movie these days, it's not actually bad to had true emotions at some point when the viewer is engaged with the characters. But no, let's just have fun the entire time, regardless of having to confront grief. You can laugh while living such grief, and even just after, but you can't just ignore it and just make fun all the time, just by saying "it's not the time to cry". If you want to keep that tone for the entire show, don't create such drama in the middle of it, or process it correctly. Guardians of the galaxy got it right, this movie didn't. I bet that the same movie, just avoiding the drama, would have had 7+ on average reviews instead of 6+. There is a lot more to say, indeed, but that was the main concern on my part. Stop writing on stuff you never actually experienced, or at least do solid research on it.

title: Would have been a good movie 10 years ago
text: Blue beetle follows the tried and tested formula that Marvel pioneered over 10 years ago now. And that's the problem. This is basically the first Iron Man movie with the one dimensional villain wanting to replicate the technology for her own gains.I enjoyed watching the leads and would like to see them in more movies. The family had their moments though the humor was a bit too much for me.Given it we made at the end of the DCU it's easy to see how there just wanted to get it released. The digital effects were a bit cartoony in some places but overall weren't too bad.The movie was predictable, enjoyable but if you haven't seen it, watch IronMan instead.

title: Dios bendiga a Xolo y a Ángel
text: I wish I could give this movie endless stars, it deserves so much more. It took my breath away how absolutely stunning, well made and overall charismatic and enjoyable it was. I cried from grief and excitement and joy and everything I am wholeheartedly in love with it.The amount of passion and dedication behind it was astonishing and so very noticeable. It moved everyone in my theater, causing all of us to laugh, clap and cheer. I'm no profesional critic but Puerto Rico 100% loved this movie. <3.I'm running out of things to say because I'm not good with words but I'm still buzzing with joy after coming out of the theater, and I hope everyone that watches it or is planning on doing so enjoys it as much as I did.

title: Another ruined character from a DC comic!
text: The movie was so badly made that I had forgotten it even as a title. The second time I watched it, it seemed even worse. Perfunctory dialogue, infantile fight scenes: "khaji-da!!!" - should I laugh or cry, it reminds me of "ka-me-ha-me-ha" xD . The scarab usually cuts through everything as if it were paper, and here I didn't see a single cut character. Where is the automatic battle mode where the scarab goes berserk and all sorts of guts fly! These liberal-pacifist films are shaken to the point of pain. The carnage is missing from this movie, sadly.P. S. Stop ruining the comic book characters of our childhood! If you can't come up with anything better, at least take a comic and make a movie series out of it, but 1:1 with the content of the comic. At least you'll make better careers that way.

title: What Walt's Watching
text:
"Blue Beetle" you had me at Susan Sarandon as the Beetles nemesis "Victoria Kord", who runs Kord Industries.Which is kinda like Wayne Enterprises/Industries for fans of the other winged creature, The Batman.I know this actor doesn't set the bar extremely high these days in her project choices, maybe in an effort to build up her superannuation stockpile, but she'll always be "Janet" dammit.There's even a moment after a fight scene where she is sprawled out on the lawn like she was as "Ms Weiss" at the end of "Rocky Horror Picture Show" after the rocket ship took off for the Transylvania Galaxy and left her & "Brad Majors" stranded behind down on Earth.Don't dream it be it!Still back to tonight's late night double feature picture show watched from the back row, "Blue Beetle".As part of the DC Universe things have gone all retro, which is very flavour of the month even down to the font and colour in the movies titles, plus the soundtrack and sets straight out of 80's "Batman"."Blue Beetle" may not be as immediately famous as the above mentioned franchise, but it's got a more than 75 year heritage, which is referenced in a couple of scenes...blink and you'll miss them.All of this is given a very diverse feel with a mainly Hispanic cast including stand up comedian and sitcom star George Lopez typecast as your conspiracy theory crazy "Uncle Rudy" driving his precious "Taco" (a dual cab Ute/truck namely a Toyota Tacoma).Talk about product placement at its finest.But the real star of this show is the recent law graduate "Jaime Reyes" ("Cobra Kai" star Xolo Mariduena) who is transformed into the Blue Beetle thanks to an alien scarab beetle that crawls up his butt and makes itself at home in its hosts back and nervous system.Thus creating a symbiotic creature not unlike those in the Spider-Man universe.Although this one can create any weapon it chooses including,at one point, a famous gamer sword.However, this "Blue Beetle" is averse to killing people.Despite this I lost count of the rising death toll in this "Eat, Love and Pray" version of a Superhero movie."Blue Beetle" is your typical superhero, whether he likes it or not.Xolo is the first Latino star to get a feature Superhero film, the writer and director are Latino as well...about damn time.Cinephile Angelo Manuel Soto does a good job herding the cattle as "Blue Beetle's" director.Regardless of the trailer's best efforts to discourage me from reviewing this flick I found it mildly entertaining and even funny at times.If subtitles put you off a movie this might not be for you, but there is more Mexican native language spoken in just over 2 hours of this action, adventure, sci-fi, thriller than you'd hear at a Guzman y Gomez outlet and it needs translation for those of us who can barely spell Mojito.Listen out for: the soundtrack with Mexican versions of popular hits (good luck naming the original songs)
A highlight for me was the battle scene using one of Motley Crue's biggest hits.What can I say I'm a fan and have seen them play live in concert in Brizneyland.So far it's barely made back its 120 million dollar budget at the world wide box office, but it will probably become a cult hit on streaming especially with an audience largely ignored by the major studios including Warner Brothers for far too long.James Gunn's ("Guardians of the Galaxy") influence is already being felt at the normally austere, dark, moody halls of DC.He's bound to shake things up with his own whacky sense of humour now he's in town.

title: Quite possibly the least original film I have ever seen
text: Iron Man. Green Lantern. Venom. These are just some of the movies Blue Beetle very obviously rips off. I know Hollywood has been seriously bereft of originality recently, but it shouldn't be this blatant. I've seen Disney remakes with more originality than this. The plot and character motivations are every predictable cliche you could expect. If you think a certain plot thread is going to go in a certain direction that's been done to death, odds are it will. And of course, there are a ton of plot holes to boot.But it doesn't stop there. The dialogue is also really stock, including multiple uses of "Do you remember", which is one step above "As you know". The art direction steals a bunch of designs. The suit is Iron Man mixed with Spider-Man's Infinity War outfit. There's a ship that looks like the one from Watchmen. Towards the end, there's a gauntlet that's literally a Power Glove. Even the Blue Beetle theme rips off a chord from the Imperial March from Star Wars.The acting is hit and miss. It ranges from surprising bland (the main character) to surprisingly annoying (his family, especially George Lopez and the sister; seriously how did Helen Mirren get a Razzie nomination over her?) to surprisingly too good for this movie (the villain; not even this film could stop Susan Sarandon from being awesome as usual).The pacing is way too slow. Part of that is because I don't care about the characters. But also, it has a similar problem to the Fantastic Four movies: not enough action. It takes a full 45 minutes for the first action scene to happen and there are only 3 in total.So, is anything good? Well, the suit, despite it's lack of originality, is cool and does some cool stuff. The visual effects are decent for the most part. There are some funny lines. And when we actually do get some action, it's well done and entertaining enough.Overall, Blue Beetle isn't one of the worst movies I've ever seen, but it may be one of the laziest. The total lack of creativity here perfectly shows how the DCEU was on it's last legs. If they do make anymore of these films (James Gunn says they plan to), here's hoping for more effort next time.

title: Favorite superhero movie ever!! 💙💙💙
text: 100 stars out of 10! Blue Beetle is by far my FAVORITE movie of the whole year!!! I am so in love with the Reyes family, especially Jaime, who is played by the amazing and comedic Xolo Mariduena. Everyone did such an outstanding job bringing this superhero to life. The movie is funny, action-packed, and focused on the power of family and love. I cannot fully stress how important it is for as many people as possible to see and support this spectacular movie!!I have already seen it three times and I could just watch it over and over again. I love everything about it. Thank you DC! We needed this cast and this movie. 🌟🔥

title: Mmm missed the mark
text: So we were excited to watch this after seeing a few of the adverts on TV so as soon as it was out we were ready with popcorn in hand for the next superhero movie. Well what can I say, it had so much potential to be the DC equivalent of ant man or venom but it's really missed the mark. So yes it plays on the atypical superhero plot, of poor kid struggling though life gets a once in a lifetime chance encounter to then become a superhero... roll on some attempts at being funny, some are and some are proper roll your eyes attempts.it just struggles along with some mild gore bits that seem to be like an unfunny attempt at deadpools comedy gore.I couldn't help but think for the second half of the film, how much are they going to push the "you're stronger if you love your family" message.To be honest this is more like a straight to streaming service type film ...I actually nodded off for a few minutes and I love my superhero action films.

title: Poor from start to finish
text: After hearing the bad press on this I debated for some time on whether to watch Blue Beetle. Unfortunately I let my curiosity over ride my common sense and I gave it a try.A good idea with the potential to make a good movie.But this is not a good movie, poor writing, far too childish for me, ridiculous at times, badly acted, and entirely let down by the production and direction.I have given Blue Beetle 2 stars based on the visual effects which in some ways were good. Although there seemed to be some blatant alignment to Marvel fight seems, armour and weaponry. There is even a hammer scene that made me think Mjolnir was on set.Really wish I hadn't bothered, DC and MC are now about as terrible as each other. I for one have officially lost interest in watching and spending on this rubbish. Do your self a favour and cut the grass, it will be more entertaining than watch this.

title: Blue Beetle
text: Blue Beetle is a DC Superhero movie. Jaime Reyes (Xolo Maridueña) returns to Palermo City after graduating college.Only prospects are slim as his family have lost their business. They are now being threatened with eviction by Kord Industries.Victoria Kord (Susan Sarandon) who runs the company has a magical alien scarab that she plans to use for military purposes.Jaime comes into contact with the scarab and gets possessed by it. He ends up with superhero powers and has to evade the goons sent by Kord Industries.Blue Beetle was billed as the first Latino orientaried superhero movie. Palermo City is bright, sunny and colourful.Visuals aside this is too run of the mill. Too routine and only younger kids will enjoy the movie.

title: Definitely could've been better.
text: Blue Beetle was something I had been awaiting to see. Not because I know much about the hero itself, but mainly because I was looking forward to something different other than The Flash or something that we've already known about for so long. Blue Beetle I knew from the Injustice video games as a playable character. The trailer itself had looked pretty cool to me and I honestly had some hopes about it. However, ehhh, it wasn't all what I had really expected it to be.The cast of this movie is fine. The effects are cool as well. That's really why I am giving it a 5/10. That's not my problem. I had a problem with how long the film was. How much it seemed to drag for me, as there wasn't really much of an engaging story to keep me focused throughout the movie. Plus, it got super annoying watching Blue Beetle the whole movie, being completely clueless on how to use his powers and running away like a scaredy-cat all the time. I would've at least thought that after the beginning, we see Blue Beetle adapt fully within himself and then become this ruthless, badass hero that we would've love to have seen. I mean, was this the actual intention the writers wanted with this character? To be lost throughout the whole 2 hours?Kinda glad I watched this movie in the comfort of my own home when I was in boredom. I couldn't have imagined seeing this on the big screen. If I did, it would've made me even more disappointed. Other than that, Blue Beetle is something I would most likely not be watching again. And the post credits weren't all that exciting to me either. So I can say for myself that I don't have anything to be looking forward to.

title: Alright superhero picture
text: I'll be outright and say was going give it a 5 or 6 but 1) nobody said "I love the Powerglove, it's so bad" and 2) there was smooching so it had to have points docked.Is a pretty good picture though. Feels a lot like the recent Saint Seiya picture with the suits and the helichopter and the climax and the chick side character parental figure lady villain. Not saying this aped the Saint Seiya picture cause they was prolly in development same time but its a trend. Not too bad a trend, suits look cool and we love a lady villain.Superheroes who whine all "noooooo, I can't kill people" are booooring and need to stop, we hate it. But we love to see acknowledging the original Blue Beetle even though this is a modern Blue Beetle picture. Blue Beetle and Booster Gold picture soon maybe?

title: Had a blast
text: I had never heard of Blue Beetle the superhero and that coupled with the name of the hero sounding kind of cheesy, I had put this movie in my watch only when bored list. Man was I mistaken because I had a blast! There is tons of action and definitely some funny moments. None of the characters felt out of place and almost all actors did a phenomenal job. The emotion and family bond that this movie relays was very heartfelt. Now I have put this movie in my must watch list and will be raving about it to my friends and family for the foreseeable future.Is the movie predictable? Yes. Does that matter? No. It's a great movie to watch with family and have fun with.

title: Copy/Paste
text: Have you seen a comic book movie before? This is one of them. If the writers were to turn this movie in for a college class, it would probably get flagged for plagiarism. Spider-Man+Ironman+Shazam = blue beetle. Everything about it is formulaic. The reluctant, goofy hero. The love interest. The witty sidekick(s). The comic relief. The evil corporate villain etc. I guess one difference is that this movie is cliché but in Spanish as well. It had some entertainment value so it's not a complete dud but still pretty bad. It's also entirely too long. I thought it was nearly over, pressed pause, and it still had a half hour left. I just started laughing and thought "holy crap why?" I had to turn it off. I will get back to the ending at some point but I honestly really don't see a need. Like I said, if you've seen one, you've seen them all. I know exactly how it's going to end and so do you.

title: Much, much better than it's 6/10 rating
text: So as a recent immigrant and citizen of Mexico and with an extended family of Mexican in-laws this movie struck a chord with me. I have avoided superhero movies since the Avengers finale and in my opinion the DC films have been 1 or 2 star offerings a best. But having heard good things I gave Blue Beetle a go. At the core it's is about a Mexican family and although they are caricatures the family dynamic rings true. The special effects are not the best but that doesn't matter when you are rooting for the heroes and engaged in the story. There is humour and although it's soppy, it's never forced and vomit-worthy like many Hollywood films. Watched it with my Oaxacan wife and we loved it.

title: Just for fun
text: This is not an Oscar winner. It wont win prizes for cinematography or sound affects. But its packed with laughs and giggles, action and good music. Give it a go...This is exactly how my familty would react if a blue bug bites me in the back. It will be mass hysteria and screaming in a very similar way.This film is for fun. For me it was something different because i had no idea who Blue Beetle is and how he came to be a bug. So from that point of view it was just a fun film for watching after a long day at work.The story isnt the worst ive seen in recent months. Unfortunately its still predictable and a bit on the screamy side. But i dont think it deserves a one or two score... Anything below 5 is a "film snob" reviewer...

title: Leftovers
text: This is one of those films that really does feel like it was made by committee, like the director, Angel Manuel Soto, was constantly being pushed aside by executive demands. There's no real star in here, so it was probably just a tussle behind the cameras as this effort to combine the desire to make a movie about family (specifically a weirdly secular but traditional Mexican family) with the needs of a big-budget action spectacle. About Blue Beetle.Jaime (Xolo Mariduena) is a university graduate in America coming home to Mexico to help his family rise out of poverty. For that, he got a pre-law degree. I hate this. This is stupid. The opening is just this collection of Millennial angst about how college is a waste of money and income inequality, and it makes no sense at all. The idea that a college degree, no matter what it's in, would lead to upward mobility is such a nonsense belief based on data from decades ago when college degrees were far rarer in the world. Someone who thinks that a pre-law degree would be the path to wealth anywhere is a fool. The only reason to get into pre-law is to go to law school, and Jaime specifically says to his sister Milagro (Belissa Escobedo) that he doesn't want to go to grad school (specifically grad school, not law school) because it will just lead to more debt. I mean, none of this ultimately matters in the longer stretch of the film's story, so it's easily forgotten. However, this is how you begin your film: a fool of an idiot who thinks a pre-law degree is going to magically help him make his family wealthy instead of...say...a mechanical engineering degree that he can't find a job for because there are too many other graduates, or something.Anyway, Milagro gets him a job at a local resort as low-level service. When she uses the guest bathroom in front of Victoria Kord (Susan Sarandon), the CEO of Kord Industries that owns the resort, she fires them both. Witnessed by Victoria's niece, Jenny (Bruna Marquezine), the two are out of jobs until Jenny offers to help Jaime get another if she stops by the central tower the next day. That also happens to be the day that she discovers that Victoria has found the scarab, a mysterious object in the shape of the insect that has mystical powers. In a rushed handoff, she gives it to Jaime while trying to evade Victoria's henchmen, the scarab choosing to bind with Jaime and make him into the Blue Beetle.So, why does the scarab bind with Jaime? At no point does the film make the case, simply repeating the fact over and over again. The problem is that it doesn't make sense. The Beetle's consciousness completely takes over Jaime's actions. He has no say in what happens for a long stretch. When he does finally gain some control, it's to tone down the Beetle's levels of violence. Essentially, the Beetle is a Terminator, and Jaime reprograms it to take knee shots (but with blue special effects because super hero movie budget). Why would the Beetle choose someone who is so materially different in outlook about the use of violence from it? They're obviously not that compatible. And then, on top of it, what does the Beetle need with a living human anyway? Seems like, if it needs a living body to function as the suit, it could take the dumbest person it could find and just control it while ignoring the person's inputs. Essentially this whole thing makes no sense.Anyway, getting past that, the film largely becomes a more standard CGI slug fest with the only real wrinkle being the emphasis on family. Jaime is from a smallish Mexican family, headed by Alberto (Damian Alcazar), who has lost his job and had a recent heart attack. There's also Jaime's grandmother Nana (Adriana Barraza) who has a secret past but an exterior of just a nice old lady. When Jaime ends up getting kidnapped by Victoria, they have to band together with Jenny, who secretly is the daughter of the original Blue Beetle who mysteriously disappeared more than a decade before. They use his tech to get Jaime out of Victoria's bunker of a base, being wacky as they do it. Sure, a good bit of it doesn't make sense (Nana being able to effectively hold and use a gatling gun that looks like it weighs at least a couple of hundred pounds is...thin, especially when she needs help getting up off the ground in the film's final scene, but whatever, I guess). It's colorful, decently photographed, and has a sense of fun to it, even if, again, little of it makes much sense. There's a connecting through mutual trauma, or something, with Victoria's chief henchman, Ignacio (Raoul Max Trujillo), and the destruction of family in the middle of a movie about how family is everything because Sarandon's character is American, I guess. I dunno.I didn't hate it. It has its moments. It's dumb, though. It makes little sense. It's helped by looking pretty good throughout. Also, what is with the insistence on making a Mexican family so thoroughly secular? Isn't part of being traditionally Mexican tied intimately with being Christian? The only time it comes through is when Nana gives Jaime a blessing before he enters the tower, but there's stuff around death and even a look into the afterlife, and Jaime's father just calls it "the universe" having a purpose.Anyway, it's not the worst of the DCEU, but it was never going to be good enough to raise the franchise from the dead. It's manic, over-produced, has some small amount of charm, and feels redundant of a whole bunch of super hero films that came before. It's not good, is what I'm saying.

title: Meh
text: Giving this 3/10 because it had a few funny moments. Other than that it's the same recipe as every superhero origin movie for the last 20 years. In fact as others have said it just feels like DC decided to copy both Spiderman and Ironman at the same time so they didn't have to bother with two film franchises. Loaded with predictably cheesy moments where it looked like the hero would lose but magically finds more power to defeat the badguy at the end. The bad guys were entirely forgettable and dull. For most of the film I couldn't have told you either of their names at any point. If this is DC's idea to compete with Marvel then I won't be watching many of their films. It just feels like a spoof copy with the same formula and a few jokes thrown in.Also, for the love of god, could we please have something a bit more interesting than evil white capitalist as the badguy for a change?

title: Really bad version of Spy Kids
text: It's like a really bad version of Spy Kids, and Spy Kids was pretty terrible.It doesn't feel like a modern superhero movie. Wouldn't look out of place on a kids TV channel.There some amusing parts in it, but not many. There's no real character development.Has different vibes of Transformers meets Spy Kids. I'm glad I gave this one a miss at the cinema but feel like I've wasted 2 hours and 4 minutes of my life watching this movie.Despite there being some famous faces in the cast, this doesn't really help with the story telling. The acting is pretty terrible but I'd blame the script more than anything.Your kids might enjoy it though.

title: Amazing
text: Blue Beetle is a cinematic gem that masterfully represents the vibrant tapestry of Latin America while maintaining the timeless elements of a superhero film. The movie immerses viewers in the richness of the region, beautifully capturing its landscapes, culture, and values. The quality of the ensemble cast is evident in each performance, lending depth and authenticity to the characters.What truly sets this film apart is its skillful incorporation of humor, which strikes a perfect balance between light-heartedness and the serious superhero narrative. This touch of levity doesn't detract from the film's emotional depth but rather enhances its relatability and entertainment value.As a superhero film, Blue Beetle doesn't shy away from the classic elements that fans love. The exhilarating action sequences, breathtaking visuals, and a compelling origin story contribute to the film's overall appeal. It pays homage to the genre's traditions while infusing it with fresh perspectives and cultural significance.Beyond its engaging plot, the movie impressively navigates the complexities of Latin American identity, celebrating its diversity and history. From the bustling streets to the heart of the Amazon rainforest, every setting feels authentic and resonates with the essence of the region.

title: A superhero movie with heart
text: Blue Beetle was a pleasant surprise. The story follows Jaime Reyes (Xolo Maridueña), a young man who gets superpowers after discovering an alien scarab in a takeaway container he was meant to guard with his life. The plot is engaging and well-paced, with enough twists and turns to keep me interested. Maridueña delivers a standout performance, and his character's journey of self-discovery and acceptance is one of the movie's strongest aspects. Other characters are well-developed and relatable. Each one has their own unique personality and motivations.Angel Manuel Soto, the director, brings a fresh and unique perspective to the superhero genre - which is a relief given the many "template" superhero movies we've had over the years. Blue Beetle is visually stunning, with some truly breathtaking shots. The score and soundtrack are excellent, and the cinematography is top-notch. The special effects are also excellent, with the alien scarab and Jaime's superpowers being particularly impressive. The dialogue is well-written and engaging, with some memorable lines. The scarab's interactions with Jaime provide some of the movie's funniest and most memorable moments. The editing is also excellent, and everything flows smoothly from scene to scene.Blue Beetle explores themes of family, identity, and the immigrant experience, which are rarely explored in superhero movies. Blue Beetle handles them with sensitivity and nuance. Mexican culture is presented with little fanfare or explanation, which is a refreshing change from the usual Hollywood approach of exoticising or stereotyping other cultures. And Jaime's family, the Reyes family, is a central part of the movie, with Jaime's relationship with his parents and younger sister providing a solid emotional core.Blue Beetle is a fun and engaging superhero movie that delivers on all fronts.

title: Great film
text: I thought omg bluebeetle good grief no way. But it turned out to be a really cool movie. Great fun tech ideas, FX fast and fun. Story line was something I could get behind. There were a couple of sad parts, but there always is. I cant believe how much I loved this film, it was fast paced which I love, it got to the story fairy quickly, I hate slow beginnings. It was a family film, with a family involved through out the movie. I love the family being a part of this story line, with a bad ass grandma and uncle. I love the humour put into most of the scenes without spoiling the overall film. All in all really enjoyable, fun, with tech, bad guys, and at the base family values and a lot of love xxx.

title: Its a superhero movie guys, its not supposed to be realistic...
text: People gotta stop taking this movie as seriously as the Joker or something. It's fun, it's funny, the characters are likeable, the entire movie was made by many from the Latin community, so people can't act like it's cultural appropriation or anything stupid like that (which they are, for some reason). Also seeing lots of complaints about cliche or realism or stuff like that. Cmon guys, its a fun superhero movie about a college kid, do you really expect it to be as dark and realistic as Batman or the Joker?It's a fun movie with really good acting, pretty funny characters, and though it has some cliche and a little bit of subpar cgi, its pretty good.

title: Overhated/disliked
text: I think this movie was one of the most fun super hero movies I've watched the last year. Sure it's not Spiderman ATSV or whatever but I deeply enjoyed this movie and how they showed off the cool powers of blue beetle that people overlook. I watched it with a friend and we agreed that this was an amazing movie with great visuals and great for kids or people who are just getting into the DC universe. Just shush and enjoy the movie and the action, trust me you'll enjoy it 20x more. A lot more people need to have in mind that sometimes it's great to turn your mind off and just enjoy the movie. ,':)

title: Not really bad, but could've been better
text: This movie is not as bad as some people say, I did not have very high hopes for it and I was pleasently surprised.On the positive: the cast for the family was top tier and everyone shines, but specially Xolo as Jaime and López as Rudy.All the great funny/cute moments come from the family interactions. I do have to say though, I think many jokes and references might go over non latinxs heads, which is why I guess some people say some jokes were not landing.Some negative in the film, as it is becoming an issue with a lot of this superhero movies, is the very flat almost cartoonish villain. Sarandon cast and acting was... a choice. Not terrible but quite basic and forgettable. We definetely need better writing for the villains in this moviesOverall the story is not super deep and yes, quite cliché and predictable but is not so terrible. If you have high hopes for this film probably you'll be dissapointed but if you look for a fun family movie time this passes quite good.This film, at least is much better than the Shazam 2 mess.

title: A Fun, Feel Good Superhero Movie
text: Blue Beetle was the first superhero movie in over a decade that made me feel something. Marvel and DC have been pushing out wild cash grabs for so long that this film was a bright refresher.The cast made me feel their performance, I was able to immerse myself. The vfx and practical effects all felt seamless and left nothing to be desired.The blatant racism was funny yet realistic. I will say that the BBEG was very one dimensional and felt flat but they were able to make her very easy to hate.All in all it's not perfect but definitely worth the ride and paying to see in theaters. I laughed, I cried, and I yelled at the screen. I would pay time and time again to watch Jaime fight for his family.

title: Absolutely Fantastic
text: This film was fun, funny, had action, great characters! This film has become one of my favorites, everyone thinks to serious and dissects films too much. This film has action, comedy, love, loyalty, sadness...this film was beautiful. Could it have been better of course! This film was a great and fun to watch with my family. There is no "stereotypes" don't overthink the film or stray away from it because there are so many harsh opinions. As a Mexican America the film was great! I'll rewatch again and again. Give it a try and let loose, the lack of interest is real! I never knew about the character and avoided this movie at all costs but man was I missing out!!

title: Parts were perfect
text: This movie was predictable, campy and suffered from glaring plot holes, but got damn it was fun to watch. Some moments were cinematic perfection, others had me physically angry.What this movie does well, it has done better than any other DC movie. What it does poorly is still better than most of the DCU.The score was amazing and most of the cast turned in fantastic performances.I have very few complaints, it was funny relatable and sets up a sequel very nicely. I would definitely watch a sequel to this movie.The end of the movie felt as cinematic as a gut wrenching cut scene from a masterpiece like Mass Effect.

title: 10 out 10
text: Came in the theater with high expectations and was NOT DISAPPOINTED!!!! Watching Cobrai Kai and seeing his determination and dedication to his role and the way he portrayed his character and seeing him act as Blue Beetle a new environment for him. But he did better than I ever was hoping!!! XOLO MARIDUENA IS THE GOAT... THE GOAT.... Go see it for yourself. STRIKE FIRST STRIKE HARD NO MERCY👊🏻 Absolutely insane can't believe how good and amazing this movie was, the family love in this movie and the Hispanic culture is incredible. If you see this movie you will NOT BE DISAPPOINTED. GO XOLO MARIDUENA!!!

title: Dominic Toretto Has Nothing On This Family
text: This kickoff to the all new DCU is beautiful. The bond the Reyes family has feels so real and like nothing could break it apart. The chemistry between all the actors is some of the best ever seen in a superhero movie. While the first act of the film does feel a bit slow, by the end of act two you will realize how crucial the pace is to the story. Even though this film does an excellent job of being a standalone entry in this new universe, the little references to other DC properties are done well and by no means feel like they are beating a dead horse. The music throughout has a 80's feel that reminds you of the height of popularity for Ted Kord's Blue Beetle. What stands out the most in this film is the emotion. Everything feels real instead of the usual forced emotion we've been made used to over the last ten years. I'd be lying if I said I didn't tear up. Well done DC, you've pulled me back in. You will laugh. You will cry. More than anything though, you will want more of the Reyes family the minute the credits role.

title: Deserved to be a massive hit.
text: It is sad to know that Blue Beetle won't have a sequel in a series of DC movies. This is a film with heart, humour, humility and humanity. The usual action sequences are all there, and they are beautifully realised, but it is the performances of all concerned that elevate this film to a very high level within the superhero genre. Xolo Mariduena is perfectly cast in the lead role, displaying all of the aforementioned qualities of the movie as a whole. It is giving nothing away in saying that the final action sequence is not the "usual" set piece of seemingly never-ending bombast that can detract from the overall rating of what may have preceded it, because Blue Beetle is ultimately about human connections, kindness and the importance of family. To my mind, Blue Beetle is up there with the original Wonder Woman movie and Man of Steel in the DC universe which has, sadly, not had the careful curation of the Marvel universe. Blue Beetle deserved a sequel and a series but will sadly receive neither because of the misguided curation of DC's ouevre. The film did not fail in itself because it is excellent. It was failed by the disjointed narrative and the lack of a common story line or thread to link the DC universe cohesively.

title: My review
text: As a Latino myself I loved the family aspect to it. It felt so real and it was so grounded Anguel Manuel Soto absolutely knocked it out of the park. Xolo is blue beetle he brought his A game. As a comic book nerd I loved everything about this film it's a once in a lifetime film and the Easter eggs and references all around it please a fan. The cinematography in this film truly makes it feel like a comic book film. And even if you weren't a fan of the hero genre you can watch this without knowing the lore of blue beetle and come in and see the chemistry between all the characters it is a real treat.

title: The Best "BLUE BEETLE" Movie ever made!!!
text: So I finally get the chance to watch Blue Beetle in the cinemas today, and OMG I gotta tell ya, this movie was so beautiful, enjoyable, and absolutely entertainment as I expected it.And it was definitely better than Erza Miller's The Flash, 1000% from my point of view. Visual Effects for CGI was pretty good and so well done, and so glad it's not all that goofy like this year's The Flash did. The Flash (2023) had messy goofy CGI effects and it was not that enjoyable, like Blue Beetle is.Xolo Maridueña, from the number 1 hit show: "Cobra Kai", did an amazing job with his performance and he's a super star of the show, and let's not forget the number 1 comedian: George Lopez! He also steals the whole show with his part! Every Latino actors did such a beautiful job, and Susan Sarandon did a great job playing the villain.This movie has so much laughs, it also has heartfelt moments, and every best action parts! This movie was all about family, strength, and love and to never forget who you believed in. The director: Angel Miguel Soto, did a splendid job with his best Superhero work for DC. This movie had pretty good story telling, and Blue Beetle is the first Latino Superhero we need!10/10.

title: Wholesome, fun.
text: I rarely ever write reviews, but I had to for this one. This movie touched my heart due to the family aspect of it, it felt really personal. Loved the humor, fight scenes, everything really. Did feel a bit short, but I don't think that's a bad thing. Maybe that's just because I loved it.This movie definitely got me out of that superhero movie fatigue and got me excited to see what's next in this new dc universe. I really hope audiences get excited to see this as much as I did, it's the only way we'll get a DC equivalent to the MCU. The movie was great standalone and I can't wait to see what's next for this superhero.

title: A good film full of cultural references
text: Ignore the bad reviews and enjoy a great film about a Latino superhero with plenty of cultural references to the Mexican and Mexican-American culture. Also, there are many references to historical events that have shaped the history of Latinos in the US.Good story, actors, music, and special effects.This film gives a good representation of Latinos and breaks with how Hollywood has represented Latinos throughout history. Embrace the film. Yes, it is not Superman or Batman, but it is Blue Beetle, and it is an enjoyable film.If you don't get the cultural references, learn about them, but do not blame the film for your lack of knowledge.

title: One of the best DCU movies besides Flash, Shazam, and Batman
text: I love the concept of the character and the themes incorporated in the film. This character kind of make me think of Spider-Man, Iron Man, and Venom because the scarab is like the symbiote of the DC universe, Jaime Reyes is like Peter Parker before he gets his powers, the villains are like Tony Stark/Iron Man's wanting to continue to make weapons for the greater good for the future. I love the cast picked for each character for the movie. I hope we get see more Jaime Reyes and other versions of Blue Beetle in the DC universe. Hope we see more of the mythology of the Blue Beetle. Hope we see more of the first and second Blue Beetle in future films.

title: Great movie
text: The best DC movie I've seen ever. Best superhero movie I've seen since the first couple Captain America movies and the first Ironman movie. Great acting by Xolo. George Lopez also gave the movie some great comedic moments. Don't know the other cast members names but Jamie's sister was very good as well. Anybody could enjoy this movie. You don't have to be into super hero movies as I myself was not a huge fan of marvel after Captain America 3. Hopefully the first movie in a trilogy. Would love to see Xolo playing blue beetle in many movies to come. Just like every super hero movie there is the super cliche "losing someone that meant a lot to me" moment. However other than that the only thing you knew that was gonna happen is Jamie not dying. All in all is a must watch and great movie.

title: Criticism of Blue Beetle based mainly on its proposal.
text: Blue Beetle stands out as one of the best superhero movies I've seen this year. It's important to note that evaluating this film in comparison to much larger-scale productions like Avengers: Infinity War is unfair. Both have distinct approaches, where Blue Beetle seeks a less grandiose and more casual approach, while Avengers aims for grandiosity as its primary goal. Therefore, I choose to evaluate each work considering its own proposals instead of comparing them.Within the scope of Blue Beetle's proposal, I highlight the exceptional work done. The performances, especially Xolo Mariduena's as the protagonist, were quite satisfactory. The direction significantly contributed to the emotion of the scenes, while the editing was competently executed. Regarding CGI, a recurring topic in discussions, it didn't bother me at any point.For me, the primary metric in a film is the emotions it can evoke, and Blue Beetle managed to do so abundantly. There are moments of anger, sadness, and anxiety that keep the viewer engaged, avoiding any sense of boredom.Naturally, the film has its negative points, such as some moments where plot conveniences exceed limits, which might hinder the viewer's experience. Additionally, a family character can be irritating at certain moments, something that personally bothered me.Overall, Blue Beetle succeeds in achieving its goal of offering a less grandiose and more relaxed cinematic experience.

title: Fun and full of heart
text: 'Blue Beetle' is a fairly by-the-book superhero origin story featuring some cool action and one of the best practical comic book movie suits I've ever seen. Xolo Maridueña is perfect in the title role as Jaime Reyes, and much like Jaime himself, the film's greatest strength is his family. Each member brings something distinct and special to the table, making the movie a joy to watch. However, the two villains are pretty generic and Susan Sarandon's acting is as believable as Bigfoot's existence. Overall, it's a fun movie with a lot of heart, delivering a solid cinematic debut for an awesome character.

title: Fun movie
text: Don't believe all the bad review. The much was fun and worth to watch on MAX.If you read all the review you would think it is the worst thing ever.Was it the best superhero movie ever?No but It is entertaining and that is all that is needed.I dont know if it is because the Snyderverse is gone because it really wasn't that good that is cause all this hate for anything else that comes nee and has a sense of humor.Do yourself a favor. Find sometime, a bowl of popcorn, and sit down and watch this. Let yourself just escape and enjoy. Agin not the best but good enough.Enjoy and have a good laugh.

title: Finally a fun DC movie
text: The antidote to all the self important, overly serious grimdark Snyderesque DC movies. Definitely the most fun of the bunch, and with easily the most likeable cast. Plot is a little formulaic, but it's a superhero origin movie, you know that going in, and it does what it says on the tin. Add to that, that a comic book film with a Latinx hero and cast is long overdue, and it comes with family dynamics that actually feel real and unforced. And I don't think I've seen George Lopez be funny before.It's not perfect, in particular Susan Sarandon as the villain is way over the top. If she had a mustache, she'd twirl it. Some of the emotional beats are predictable, but they're hit well.To sum up, it's warm, colorful, and fun.

title: Viva La Raza ✊🏽
text: ChatGPT: I can help you outline the key points you might consider while discussing your appreciation for the movie "Blue Beetle" and its representation of the Latino community. (ChatGPT is amazing, it pretty much summed up what I wanted to convey in one second. It saved me hours)"Blue Beetle" has resonated strongly within the Latino community due to its significant representation and cultural relevance. The film, centered around Jaime Reyes, not only showcases a superhero narrative but also delves into Jaime's heritage and background, effectively reflecting the experiences of many Latinos. The character's identity struggle, balancing life as a teenager and a newfound superhero, mirrors the challenges faced by numerous individuals navigating their cultural identity in a diverse society.The movie beautifully weaves elements of Latino culture into the storyline, embracing traditions, familial values, and community connections. Jaime's family dynamics, filled with warmth, support, and strong ties, authentically depict the close-knit nature prevalent in many Latino households. Additionally, the film subtly incorporates Spanish language and cultural references, adding depth and authenticity to the narrative.Moreover, the representation of Jaime as a Latino superhero is empowering and inspiring for many within the community. His character embodies resilience, courage, and a sense of responsibility, becoming a role model for audiences who rarely see themselves portrayed as superheroes on screen. This representation not only fosters a sense of pride but also fosters a feeling of belonging and recognition within the Latino audience.Furthermore, "Blue Beetle" goes beyond mere representation by addressing relevant societal issues that affect the Latino community. The film touches upon themes of identity, discrimination, and the importance of embracing one's heritage. By addressing these issues within a superhero context, the movie effectively highlights their significance while delivering an entertaining and relatable story.In conclusion, "Blue Beetle" stands as a significant milestone in portraying the diversity and richness of the Latino community on the big screen. Through its compelling storyline, cultural authenticity, and representation of a Latino superhero, the movie not only entertains but also resonates deeply with audiences, offering a powerful reflection of the experiences, values, and challenges faced by many within the Latino community.

title: Typical, but Fun Superhero Movie
text: Superhero shows are everywhere. They are inescapable. There are always shows based on Batman, Spiderman, Avengers, Justice League, etc.,. Then, last week, another one arrived in the form of the Blue Beetle - a superhero that I've never heard of until I started seeing the previews for this year's flick "Blue Beetle" directed by Angel Manuel Soto. Now that I've watched that film, I can say that I'm glad that I did because even though it doesn't reinvent the wheel, it certainly stands out from other superhero movies with its emphasis on heritage and family."Blue Beetle" is about Jaime (pronounced Hi-may) Reyes (played by Xolo Maridueña) and how he becomes the titular superhero. An alien scarab chooses the recent college graduate to be its symbiotic host, providing him with a suit of armor that's capable of extraordinary and unpredictable powers. This forever changes his destiny.Like I said before, I never heard of Blue Beetle until this film came out this year. I did some research, and it turns out that Jaime is the third person to have done the suit since the character first appeared in the DC Universe in 1939. The other two are Dan Garrett and Ted Kord, whose suits actually appear in the flick while Jaime, Jenny (Ted's daughter and played by Bruna Marquezine), and Uncle Rudy (played by George Lopez) explore Ted's lab. This is a nice and clever way to acknowledge the Blue Beetles who came before the current one.The flick itself is not particularly innovative, which is not necessarily a bad thing in this case. While watching it, I noticed that it took elements from other superheroes films from the last 5-10 years. There always has to be romance even if it's not all that necessary. In this film, it's between Jaime and Jenny.
